articles.title: BRICS expansion hopefuls seek to rebalance world order
articles.description: An expansion of the BRICS bloc under consideration at a summit this week has attracted a motley crew of potential candidates - from Iran to Argentina - with one thing in common: a desire to level a global playing field many consider rigged against them.
articles.content:
[1/6] People walk past the Sandton Convention Centre, which will host the upcoming BRICS Summit, in Johannesburg, South Africa August 19, 2023. REUTERS/James Oatway Acquire Licensing Rights

articles.title: Nottingham Forest in ‘advanced negotiations’ for World Cup winner as two transfers ‘close’
articles.description: The latest Nottingham Forest transfer news as the Reds have been linked with a move for two Argentina internationals as they look to strengthen their squad.
articles.content:
Nottingham Forest are in ‘advanced negotiations’ to sign Sevilla and Argentina right-back Gonzalo Montiel, with a deal for Argentina teammate Nicolas Dominguez also ‘close’, according to reports in their home land.

articles.title: Cong accuses govt of using G20 to run ‘election campaign’
articles.description: The grouping comprises Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, the Republic of Korea, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Turkey, the UK, the US and the European Union (EU).
articles.content:
The G20 members represent around 85 per cent of the global GDP, over 75 per cent of the global trade, and about two-thirds of the world population.(Express Photo)

articles.title: Argentina's Milei pitched dollarization 'models' in IMF meet - sources
articles.description: Argentina's surprise presidential front-runner, radical libertarian Javier Milei, pitched models of dollarizing the South American country's economy in a meeting with major lender the International Monetary Fund on Friday, two sources said.
articles.content: LONDON, Aug 18 (Reuters) - Argentina's surprise presidential front-runner, radical libertarian Javier Milei, pitched models of dollarizing the South American country's economy in a meeting with major lender the International Monetary Fund on Friday, ... [2614 chars]

articles.title: Forget the dollar, Argentina should adopt the euro as its currency, Nobel economist Paul Krugman says
articles.description: The South American nation does almost twice as much trade with the EU as it does with the US, Paul Krugman pointed out.
articles.content:
Nora Mazzini
Argentina should adopt the euro, not the dollar, in order to tackle hyperinflation, Nobel economist Paul Krugman said.
The South American nation does almost twice as much trade with the EU as it does with the US, he pointed out.

articles.title: Argentina's top presidential candidate wants to use the US dollar to crush inflation and transform the country's economy
articles.description: An adviser to Milei said hyperinflation prevents structural reform and that dollarization is "a means to achieve economic and political objectives."
articles.content:
dollar SOPA images
Argentina presidential candidate Javier Milei wants the country to use the US dollar.
He sees the greenback as a tool to crush sky-high inflation and rescue an ailing economy.
